active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a resource-constrained organization, should you prioritize technical feeds (IoCs) or tactical feeds (TTPs) for threat hunting? Debate with evidence from real-world examples (e.g., WannaCry IoC blocking vs. MITRE ATT&CK TTP mapping), considering integration challenges, false positive rates, and long-term efficacy.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Threat Intelligence Feeds Integration (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Threat Intelligence And Hunting > 011_Threat Hunting > 011_004_Threat Hunting Tools and Technologies > Threat Intelligence Platforms > Threat Intelligence Feeds Integration). Generate 50 high-quality flashcards using the provided schema. Cover all content comprehensively, drawing from this synthesized knowledge base: [Insert full scaffolding layers here verbatim]. Incorporate research: TI definitions from CrowdStrike/Wiz/TechTarget; Types: Technical (IoCs: IPs/hashes/domains), Tactical (TTPs), Operational (campaigns), Strategic (trends); Tools: MISP, ThreatConnect, SIEM (Splunk/ELK), SOAR/EDR; Best practices: API ingestion, STIX/TAXII, false positive mitigation; Examples: Ransomware IoCs, SolarWinds TTPs. Align to Bloom's objectives: [Insert learning_objectives array here]. Embed active learning hooks: Reference discussion on Technical vs. Tactical prioritization, peer teaching on feed types, problem-solving with sample JSON. Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcards, each as: {'front': 'question text', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'distractors': ['opt1', 'opt2', 'opt3'] (if MCQ), 'bloom_level': 'Apply (Layer 3)', 'scaffolding_layer': 'Layer 3 Implementation'}}. Ensure pedagogical best practices: Active recall, spaced repetition friendly, distractors from common errors (e.g., confusing feed types, ignoring false positives).
